page.title: 19Local Names
page.content: The names in our area reflect its past and its character. Ipswich: Gyppeswyk -or Gipe's trading settlement (from Old English) Maidenhall: After the farm which was once on this site and which still existed in 1910. Stoke: From "stoc" or dairy farm (Old English). Stoke is still referred to by the people of Ipswich as "over Stoke", reflecting that it once was a village separate from the town Stoke Park private housing estate recalls the old Stoke Park House and grounds, once owned by Lord Gwydyr. Halifax: Halifax Primary School over- looks the estuary where once there was a shipyard of that name. Ed.
